headline: GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker lied about his college achievements
author: Kelly McClure
sentences: Although any mention of collegiate achievements has since been scrubbed from Walker's campaign media sometime between December and January, it's unclear why the claim was made in the first place, or why there have been instances as recent as 2017 when the claim has been made.

For years now, GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker has boasted about graduating in the top 1% of his class at the University of Georgia; but recent evidence has come to light indicating that he actually didn't graduate at all.

A native of Georgia, Walker lived in Dallas after retiring from football but changed his voter registration to the address of a house in Atlanta owned by his wife in order to qualify for his candidacy, according to NPR.

As a longtime friend and supporter of former President Trump, he received his immediate sign-off and has appeared alongside him at rallies and functions, including the most recent "Save America Tour."
